Stewart F. Hicks Papers, 1931-1933

Finding aid created by
Dallas Pillen in February, 2015

did.abstract: Stewart F. Hicks graduated from the University of Michigan with a Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering in 1927 and worked as an engineer for the Michigan State Highway Department on bridge construction projects. The Stewart F. Hicks papers primarily document Hicks's work as a bridge project engineer during the construction of the Manistee Memorial Bridge as well as academic pursuits and early professional work.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: Donated by Robert W. Green (donor no. 11132) in June, 2014.

accruals.p: No further additions to the collection are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Stewart F. Hicks papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Stewart F. Hicks graduated from the University of Michigan with a Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering in 1927 and later earned his Master of Science from the University in 1936. His early professional work included working as an assistant to the Village Manager of the Village of Plymouth before he began working for the Michigan State Highway Department as an engineer in charge of bridge construction projects in the 1930s. Hicks worked as a bridge project engineer on a number of bridges, including the Manistee Memorial Bridge.

arrangement.p: The collection is organized into two series: Academic and Professional Records and Manistee Memorial Bridge.

scopecontent.p: The Stewart F. Hicks papers document Hicks' professional career as an engineer. The collection includes some materials related to his academic pursuits and early professional work, but the bulk of the collection relates to Hicks' work as a bridge project engineer on the Manistee Memorial Bridge. Materials relating to the Manistee Memorial Bridge project include correspondence to and from Hicks, daily reports prepared by Hicks, and project files including proposals, charts, blueprints, reports, and news regarding the bridge's dedication.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.subject: Bridges--Michigan.
Bridges--Design and construction--Michigan.
Civil engineering.
Engineers--Michigan.
controlaccess.corpname: University of Michigan. College of Engineering.

scopecontent.p: The Academic and Professional Records series (1924-1933, 0.25 linear feet, 1 oversize volume, and 1 oversize folder) consists of a notebook, correspondence, a drawing, a scrapbook containing photographs, reference booklets, and maps detailing Hicks's early academic and professional career.

Michigan State Highway Department, "Standard Road and Bridge Specifications," 1926
Michigan State Highway Department, County Road Maps
Michigan State Highway Department, "Official Michigan Service Map," 1931
Michigan State Highway Department, "Official Michigan Service Map," 1932

scopecontent.p: The Manistee Memorial Bridge series (1931-1934, 0.5 linear feet) comprises the bulk of the collection and contains correspondence, reports, blueprints, charts, and news items related to Hicks's work as bridge project engineer during the construction of the Memorial Bridge on U.S. 31 in Manistee.
